meanings.definition: Relating to the study of cells.
meanings.sent1: The cytologically examination of the cell sample revealed abnormalities.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted a cytologically analysis of the cell structure.
meanings.sent3: The cytologically detailed report on the cell structure was surprisingly engaging.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of the cell structure was so cytologically deep, it was like reading a novel.
meanings.sent5: The cytologically intricate world of cells fascinated the students in biology class.

meanings.definition: In a manner pertaining to cellular structure and function.
meanings.sent1: She observed the cells cytologically under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the patient cytologically to determine the cause of the illness.
meanings.sent3: The scientist humorously described the cells cytologically as tiny factories.
meanings.sent4: The information flowed cytologically through the research paper, making it easy to understand.
meanings.sent5: The professor explained the concept cytologically, making it crystal clear to the students.
